story:
Once upon a time in the beautiful land of Afghanistan, there was a small, peaceful village nestled in a lush green valley. The village was known for its vibrant pomegranate trees, and every year the villagers would celebrate the pomegranate festival to give thanks for the abundant fruit.

Farida was a kind-hearted girl who lived in this village with her mother and father. She loved the pomegranate festival, as it brought joy and laughter to her community each year. Farida had a peculiar fascination with pomegranates; she thought they were the world's most beautiful and intriguing fruit.

This particular year, just before the festival, a mysterious old woman arrived in the village. She settled on the outskirts in a small, humble dwelling. The villagers welcomed her, but they kept a respectful distance, as the old woman seemed distant and mysterious.

One day, Farida decided to take some pomegranates to the old woman, hoping to make friends. The old woman was pleased by her visit and offered Farida a pomegranate in return. Farida curiously noticed that this pomegranate was unlike any she had ever seen; it was shimmering and golden.

The old woman smiled and told Farida, "This is the magical golden pomegranate that grants one wish for those who believe. Give it back to the earth when you're ready, and your wish will come true."

Farida couldn't believe it! Her love for pomegranates had led her to this enchanting gift. She thanked the old woman, took the golden pomegranate home and guarded it like a treasure.

When the pomegranate festival finally rolled around, Farida realized that while the villagers were content, their lives were still difficult. The village had no proper school, and Farida dreamed of learning and growing alongside her friends every day. She decided to make that her wish.

During the festival, just as the villagers finished their meal, Farida stood up to address the crowd. She spoke of the unique golden pomegranate and shared her wish for a school. Farida believed that providing education for all the children in the village, regardless of their circumstances, would create a brighter future for everyone.

The villagers listened in awe, and the mysterious old woman appeared among them. She nodded approvingly at Farida's wish and watched as the golden pomegranate was gently planted in the ground at the heart of the village. And, as they all stood there, something extraordinary happened: the golden pomegranate began to grow.

In the most miraculous way, a school arose seemingly overnight. It had rooms for learning, books for eager minds, and a garden to inspire the children's creativity.

Henceforth, Farida and her friends spent their days exploring the wonders and mysteries of a magical education. With their minds full of knowledge and their hearts brimming with joy, the children vowed to use their education to help others, both near and far.

Farida and her friends grew up to become great helpers, changemakers, and leaders; a testament to their devoted parents, the generosity of the mysterious old woman, and, of course, the power of a magical golden pomegranate that had once shone in the hands of a little girl.

And so, as the twilight fell and the stars began to dance in the sky above, Farida tucked her child in, and whispered, "Always remember, my dear, the magic that resides in the heart of a pomegranate."

With a smile and filled with dreams, Farida's child drifted off to sleep. As Farida sat there in quiet reflection, she decided that her daughter should inherit the magical golden pomegranate to cherish and, perhaps, when the time was right, to make a wish for an ever brighter future for their beautiful village in the valley.

And as the village slept beneath the starlight, the legacy of a golden pomegranate blossomed in every heart and every hopeful dream, ensuring a magical and loving future for them all.
